trans-unit.source: Create packages
trans-unit.target: Create packages

trans-unit.source: Intermediate Programmer
trans-unit.target: Intermediate Programmer

trans-unit.source: Open your project in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Open your project in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: !Note Game Studio will later support creating NuGet packages directly.
trans-unit.target: !Note Game Studio will later support creating NuGet packages directly.

trans-unit.source: First of all, after saving all your changes, open your project with Visual Studio. You can easily do this by clicking the appropriate button on the toolbar:
trans-unit.target: First of all, after saving all your changes, open your project with Visual Studio. You can easily do this by clicking the appropriate button on the toolbar:

trans-unit.source: Open project in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Open project in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: A few things to look out for:
trans-unit.target: A few things to look out for:

trans-unit.source: Delete unecessary assets (i.e. GameSettings, etc...)
trans-unit.target: Delete unecessary assets (i.e. GameSettings, etc...)

trans-unit.source: Delete unecessary PackageReference
trans-unit.target: Delete unecessary PackageReference

trans-unit.source: Optional: Setup Package properties
trans-unit.target: Optional: Setup Package properties

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer, right-click on the project and click on Properties.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer, right-click on the project and click on Properties.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Package tab and edit Package version, description, URL, etc.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Package tab and edit Package version, description, URL, etc.

trans-unit.source: Setup package properties
trans-unit.target: Setup package properties

trans-unit.source: Pack
trans-unit.target: Pack

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer, right-click on the project and click on Pack.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer, right-click on the project and click on Pack.

trans-unit.source: Pack project
trans-unit.target: Pack project

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio will build and pack the project. The resulting .nupkg should be in bin\Debug or bin\Release folder, depending on your configuration.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio will build and pack the project. The resulting .nupkg should be in bin\Debug or bin\Release folder, depending on your configuration.

trans-unit.source: Publish
trans-unit.target: Publish

trans-unit.source: You can now publish the .nupkg file on a NuGet repository such as nuget.org.
trans-unit.target: You can now publish the .nupkg file on a NuGet repository such as nuget.org.

trans-unit.source: There is several ways to do that: nuget.exe client, dotnet.exe client or nuget.org Upload Package
trans-unit.target: There is several ways to do that: nuget.exe client, dotnet.exe client or nuget.org Upload Package

trans-unit.source: For additional information, please reference to Publishing packages in NuGet documentation.
trans-unit.target: For additional information, please reference to Publishing packages in NuGet documentation.

trans-unit.source: Once your package is properly listed, it can now be consumed by other Stride users!
trans-unit.target: Once your package is properly listed, it can now be consumed by other Stride users!
